abstract: I.B.M. said it received a lift from strong growth in big emerging markets, led by China, India, Brazil and Russia, where revenue jumped 29 percent.
snippet: I.B.M. said it received a lift from strong growth in big emerging markets, led by China, India, Brazil and Russia, where revenue jumped 29 percent.
lead_paragraph: The leading high-technology industrial companies like Intel, General Electric and I.B.M., which have reported quarterly results in the last several days, are seen by analysts and economists as bellwethers of the economy, because their chips, equipment and services are used in so many industries.

headline.main: I.B.M. Rides Global Focus on Services to Deliver a 12% Increase in Profit
headline.print_headline: I.B.M. Rides Global Focus on Services to Deliver a 12% Increase in Profit

abstract: Just so you know, the Citigroup chairman has a leather jacket that works. It does.
snippet: Just so you know, the Citigroup chairman has a leather jacket that works. It does.
lead_paragraph: 4:25 p.m. | Updated Daily Intel caught up with Richard D. Parsons, Citigroup‘s chairman, on Monday night at the Jazz Foundation of America‘s annual loft party on Sunday. Among the topics of conversation: Mr. Parsons’ leather jacket, an item of clothing he loved — he’s worn it a lot — but didn’t want written about.

headline.main: Citi’s Parsons Has a Leather Jacket That ‘Works’

abstract: Intel said it plans to invest $6 billion to $8 billion to upgrade plants in the U.S., adding as many as 1,000 new high-tech positions and thousands of construction jobs.
snippet: Intel said it plans to invest $6 billion to $8 billion to upgrade plants in the U.S., adding as many as 1,000 new high-tech positions and thousands of construction jobs.
lead_paragraph: The Intel Corporation said on Tuesday that it planned to invest $6 billion to $8 billion to upgrade manufacturing plants in the United States and build a new one in Oregon, adding as many as 1,000 new high-tech positions and thousands of construction jobs.

headline.main: Intel to Build New Chip Plant in Oregon, and Upgrade Others
headline.print_headline: Intel to Build New Chip Plant in Oregon, and Upgrade Others
